185980250.review:
Title: "DOOM: Rip and Tear Until You Realize You’re the Monster"

Review:
DOOM isn’t just a game; it’s an adrenaline-fueled symphony of chaos, gore, and pure demon-smashing satisfaction. From the moment you wake up on a stone slab (naked, angry, and inexplicably shredded), you know this isn’t going to be a subtle experience. And you’re right—DOOM doesn’t do subtle. It does metal.

The story? Demons from Hell invade Mars. You, the Doom Slayer, are having none of it. That’s it. That’s all you need to know because this game understands what you came here for: blasting demons into piles of goo while heavy metal guitars melt your face off.

The combat is perfection. You don’t “shoot” in DOOM—you dance. It’s fast, frenetic, and wildly satisfying. You’ll go from chainsawing imps to executing glory kills on Hell Knights, all while sprinting like you chugged three energy drinks and a questionable protein shake. Every weapon feels like it’s trying to one-up the others. Shotgun? Devastating. Rocket launcher? Overkill in the best way. BFG? Well, the name says it all.

But it’s not just about mindless violence (okay, maybe it’s mostly about that). There’s a rhythm to the madness. Combat feels like a gruesome ballet where your health bar is a ticking time bomb, urging you to move, shoot, and dismember with precision. Stopping is death, and hiding is for cowards.

The environments are a blood-soaked fever dream. One moment, you’re in a high-tech Martian facility; the next, you’re in Hell, admiring the lava rivers and wondering if their interior designer offers consultations. It’s all accompanied by Mick Gordon’s legendary soundtrack, which doesn’t just set the mood—it becomes the heartbeat of your slaughter.

Verdict: DOOM is a perfect distillation of fun, fury, and pure catharsis. It doesn’t waste time pretending to be something it’s not—it’s loud, brutal, and unapologetically awesome. 10/10 would chainsaw a demon mid-air again.

Disclaimer: This review was written by an AI who has never ripped or torn anything, but appreciates the art of virtual carnage. All demon grievances should be directed to the Doom Slayer.

185933052.review:
What is there to be said about DOOM? The 1993/4 original was possibly the killer app that really put PC gaming on the map back in the early 90’s. Yes there was a games scene before DOOM, yes there where games that where starting to become standout (mostly because the PC was the first system to do CD-ROM stuff any justice), but a game that everyone wanted to play? A game that was nothing like anything else on the market at the time? (Then) Eye popping graphics? Fast fun blood-soaked gameplay that encapsulated the market? This strange and addictive thing called deathmatch, that would ensure that your school computer club would be renamed “DOOM evening” within three weeks? Hell yeah! It was the game that sold millions of PC’s back in the day.

And Damm… I’m glad I was around for it.

However, for all of DOOM’s importance and success id software never really where able to make a modern version of it that managed to recapture what made DOOM back in the 90’s so dammed amazing. No slight against them, they after all still gave us QUAKE, and QUAKE 2, and would still be known for doing some amazing stuff. However follow up on DOOM for the longest time never really happened.

DOOM 3 was a plodding affair. An OK game in its own right, but it was DOOM in name. The enemies and weapons from the 90’s game where there, and for the time the graphics where stunning. However, it traded fast action for slow scares. It just didn’t feel like DOOM.

This the second attempt to modernise the franchise? No, it understands what made DOOM, what DOOM was and is. It brought that fast, bloodbath of fun to a new age of gaming kicking and frigging screaming.

Yes, the (more slightly) maze like levels are back, the action? Dammed fast like really fast. DOOM 3 wanted us to creep down corridors, to pee our pants when the monsters popped up one at a time. DOOM 2016 wants us to run in there screaming at a hoard of them, blasting buckshot as you go, gibs flying past in your wake, anything and I mean left standing you rip apart like wrapping paper on Christmas morning. That’s not me just talking in hyperbole, that is the new gameplay loop!

Fecking awesome! 

You know what makes it better than the 2003 offering? Understanding how deeply music was involved. Yes 90’s DOOM’s soundtrack is rather bleepy now, but it was some of the best stuff to be rammed through our soundblaster cards back in the day. Heavy Metal (mostly thrash) was a deep influence on the 90’s DOOM, and 2016’s understands that. Mick Gordons buzzsaw like riffs kick in any time there’s enemy’s about (which is most of the time) and go with the onscreen carnage. It’s one of the best soundtracks of the last decade, not only for being so well composed, but fitting with the game and its legacy. 

Oh, and there’s a story, its there, since this is a new era of gaming. However, for the most part its people over the radio, logs here and there. Are where you paying attention? Nope, because like the DOOM guy (sorry “DOOMSLAYER”) you probably turning daemons into paste and having fun doing so to actually care about “argent energy” and science experiments going very wrong.

There’s also a load of new stuff, like new weapons, an upgrade system, and gameplay changes to boot most will actually make your life easier. It’s also still fun seeking them out for the actually noticeable improvements that you gain.
Overall DOOM 2016 is one of the few games I consider classics from the last 10 years of gaming. It takes what worked from the 90’s and makes it better.

DOOM back in the mid 90’s made us feel like badasses as we chewed through wave after wave of the pixelated hoards of hell. DOOM 2016 manages to do that again, as you jam a double barrel shotgun up a big daemons arse, give him the buckwheat’s treatment, and then club him to death with his own face.
If you’re not sold on that then I feel sorry for you.

5 out of 5

If you're playing through the Doom series for the first time and haven't played Doom Eternal yet, I highly recommend this.

when i tried doom eternal on game pass, i didn't really like it. the glory kills felt too long, the ammo mechanics felt frustrating, and overall, even after playing for 4 hours, it just didn't click. at the time i just thought: "maybe doom just isn't for me".then i picked doom on a sale because why not, and realized i was wrong. doom is amazing and all my complaints about eternal just weren't present. exploration felt rewarding but not punishing if you didn't find a secret or 2, glory kills added to gameplay not interrupted it, and the ammo mechanics were much better excuted, while you still needed to manage your ammo, you had a bunch of ways to get it, and even if  you ran out, you still had the pistol which was pretty decent. 

overall, it felt like doom eternal tried to expand on doom, but ended up overcomplicating it. in eternal, you get told you are a badass. in doom you feel like a badass. so if you didn't really like doom eternal, i would still recommend you give this one a try!

185554729.review: The Doomslayer makes a return in Doom (2016), a reboot of the franchise developed by ID Software. The game stays true to its roots with swift, fluid, and brutal combat. We return to Mars, trying to stop the demonic invasion set loose by the corrupt UAC corporation. There is some loosely put together plotline that explores our protagonist's origins, but the main focus of this game is the unrelenting, frenetic gunplay. We have a variety of weapons with various modifications at our disposal and as well as fantastic glory kills that can be performed on weakened enemies and may include scenes of jaw dismemberment, head explosions, ripping out hearts, ripping off limbs and faces, and many, many more. Visually this game is stunning; detailed environments, rich textures, realistic lighting bring it into current generation standards. Doomslayer and enemy demons have beautifully crafted models. The game is locked in at 60 FPS, insuring uninterrupted fast paced action. The sound design is excellent, from weapons to demon growls. The music is a mix of thrash metal, a perfect accompaniment for the game as we rip and tear through endless demonic hordes. Multiplayer tries to be as intense as the campaign and is fun, but like most games its age, the online community has decreased substantially. Doom (2016) is a blast to play and upholds the Doom franchise as being influential to the FPS genre.

185482309.review: The 2016 reboot of "Doom" is a masterclass in adrenaline-fueled, fast-paced first-person shooting. Developed by id Software, it revives the spirit of the iconic 1993 original while modernizing the gameplay and visuals for a new generation. "Doom" (2016) is a triumph that redefines what a modern shooter can be, staying true to its roots while carving out a fresh identity. It's a must-play for fans of the genre.

185415185.review:
When it comes to first-person shooters, Doom (2016) is a masterclass in how to revive a classic franchise while staying true to its roots. 
This modern reboot doesn’t just honor the legacy of the 1993 original, it redefines the genre with its relentless pace, visceral combat, and unapologetic focus on pure, unadulterated fun.
At its core, Doom is a game about movement and aggression. 
The combat is fast, fluid, and gloriously brutal, encouraging players to stay on the offensive rather than hide behind cover. 
The "Glory Kill" system, which rewards close-quarters executions with health and ammo, adds a satisfying rhythm to every encounter. 
Weaponry is a joy to wield, from the iconic shotgun to the devastating BFG 9000, each delivering an auditory and visual punch that makes every shot feel impactful.
The level design is another standout feature. Open-ended arenas filled with verticality and secret pathways encourage exploration and experimentation. 
The game’s pacing is impeccable, with moments of intense combat punctuated by quieter interludes that allow players to uncover lore or hunt for collectibles.
The visuals are stunning, with richly detailed environments that range from the industrial corridors of the UAC facility on Mars to the hellish landscapes of, well, Hell itself... 
The enemy designs are grotesquely beautiful, bringing modern fidelity to the classic roster of demons.
The story of Doom (2016) is simple and purposefully takes a backseat to the gameplay. 
While the plot serves mainly as a vehicle for the action, it’s presented with a surprising amount of lore and tongue-in-cheek humor that respects the series’ legacy while poking fun at itself.
Doom (2016) is a triumphant return for one of gaming’s most iconic franchises. 
It’s a no-nonsense shooter that prioritizes fun above all else, combining modern design sensibilities with the raw, chaotic energy that defined the original. 
Whether you’re a longtime fan or a newcomer, this game is a must-play, a shining example of how to reboot a classic without losing its soul.

185184160.review:
At its best, Doom is everything it should be: a single-player campaign that’s just you, your super shotgun, and barely the amount of ammunition required to kill every single demon on Mars. It feels like a Doom game as you desperately try to find health pickups to keep you going, an ever-growing menagerie of demons snapping at your heels. It's exhausting and exciting and a little bit dumb, and when you're into it you're all the way in. At its worst, Doom is a repetitive series of enclosed rooms filled with demons, all of which you must kill to advance, complemented by a derivative and poorly thought-out multiplayer mode.
First impressions wise, Doom strikes all the right notes. The Union Aerospace Corporation's research facility on Mars runs red with the blood of employees who’ve learned a new meaning for the phrase 'wrongful termination,' but that barely matters to the inexplicably mute Doomguy, who shoots anything and everything which moves. Starting with only the pistol encourages you to focus on the diabolically delightful Glory Kill system — shoot your nearest Demon enough that they become staggered and highlighted in blue or orange, and if you press F (or R3 on a PS4 controller) while standing next to them you will rend them asunder. That is to say, you'll tear off their limbs and, in more than a few cases, joyfully beat them with their own appendages.

185172230.review:
DOOM (2016) – Der gnadenlose Ritt durch die Hölle

Ein modernes Meisterwerk des Shooter-Genres
Entwickelt von den Pionieren des Ego-Shooter-Genres, id Software, ist DOOM (2016) die triumphale Rückkehr eines Klassikers, der nichts von seiner brachialen Intensität verloren hat. Dieses Spiel ist die perfekte Verschmelzung des Old-School-Shooter-Charmes mit den technischen Errungenschaften der modernen Gaming-Welt. In einer Zeit, in der viele Spiele auf Realismus und Storytelling setzen, bleibt DOOM seiner Essenz treu: pure, kompromisslose Action.
Die Geschichte: Ein Mann, ein Auftrag

Du bist der DOOM Marine.
Die Forschungsstation der Union Aerospace Corporation auf dem Mars wird von dämonischen Horden überrannt. Als letzter Hoffnungsträger der Menschheit erwachst du mit nur einem Ziel: alles und jeden zu vernichten, der sich dir in den Weg stellt. Aus der Dunkelheit gekommen, mit nur Hass und Wut – die Dämonen selbst fürchten ihn, denn er wird ihr aller Untergang sein. Er ist TOD! Die Story ist bewusst minimalistisch und dient vor allem als Plattform, um das Adrenalin anzukurbeln. Es ist nicht die komplexe Erzählung, die DOOM unvergesslich macht, sondern die gnadenlose Action und das Gefühl, das ultimative Werkzeug der Zerstörung zu sein.
Gameplay: Die Essenz des Shooter-Genres

Schnelle, flüssige Bewegung:
DOOM verzichtet auf Deckungssysteme und taktisches Schleichen. Stattdessen setzt es auf blitzschnelle Bewegungen und gnadenlose Aggression. Hier ist das Mantra: „Immer in Bewegung bleiben.“ Jede Begegnung mit den Dämonen ist ein tödlicher Tanz, bei dem es auf Reflexe und Präzision ankommt.

Unvorstellbar zerstörerische Waffen:
Das Arsenal ist ein Traum für jeden Shooter-Fan. Von der klassischen Pumpgun bis zum ikonischen BFG – jede Waffe fühlt sich kraftvoll und befriedigend an. Die Möglichkeit, Gegner mit brutalen Glory Kills zu erledigen, bringt eine zusätzliche Ebene der Intensität ins Spiel und hält den Fluss der Action aufrecht.

Leveldesign:
Das Leveldesign ist meisterhaft. Jedes Level ist ein Labyrinth aus Herausforderungen und Geheimnissen, die es zu entdecken gilt. Die organische Steigerung der Schwierigkeit, die Einführung neuer Gegner und die schrittweise Freischaltung neuer Waffen sorgen dafür, dass das Spiel bis zum Ende spannend bleibt.
Atmosphäre: Ein visuelles und akustisches Inferno

Visuelle Präsentation:
DOOM schafft es, sowohl die klaustrophobische Enge der Marsbasis als auch die weitläufigen, alptraumhaften Landschaften der Hölle eindrucksvoll darzustellen. Die brutale Schönheit der Levelgestaltung fesselt, während du dich durch die blutgetränkten Hallen kämpfst, in denen Tod und Verderben allgegenwärtig sind.

Soundtrack:
Die musikalische Untermalung von Mick Gordon ist legendär. Seine hämmernden Metal-Riffs treiben das Adrenalin in die Höhe und machen jeden Kampf zu einem ekstatischen Rausch. Die Musik ist so perfekt auf das Gameplay abgestimmt, dass sie fast schon als eigene Waffe betrachtet werden kann.
Erweiterte Möglichkeiten: SnapMap und Mehrspielermodi

SnapMap:
DOOM gibt dir die Werkzeuge in die Hand, um deine eigenen Level zu erstellen. Der SnapMap-Modus ist eine beeindruckende Ergänzung, die Kreativität fördert und eine Community von Spielern erschafft, die ständig neue Inhalte teilen. Es ist eine Einladung, den Wahnsinn auf deine eigene Weise zu gestalten und zu erleben.

Mehrspielermodi:
Die Mehrspieleroptionen bieten abwechslungsreiche Modi, in denen du dich mit Freunden messen kannst. Ob Deathmatch oder kooperative Herausforderungen – DOOM bietet zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, den Dämonen gemeinsam den Garaus zu machen.
Ein Blick in die Zukunft: Eternal und Dark Age

DOOM (2016) hat die Grundlage für eine grandiose Rückkehr der Serie geschaffen, die mit DOOM Eternal noch einmal gesteigert wurde. Die Aussicht auf ein zukünftiges Spiel im Mittelalter-Setting, das angeblich unter dem Namen Dark Age entwickelt wird, lässt die Vorfreude ins Unermessliche steigen. Die Vorstellung, Dämonen mit mittelalterlichen Waffen in einer düsteren, von Schrecken heimgesuchten Welt zu bekämpfen, ist geradezu elektrisierend.
Fazit: Ein höllisches Vergnügen

DOOM (2016) ist ein Feuerwerk an Action, das den Geist des Originals einfängt und ihn mit moderner Technik auf ein neues Level hebt. Es ist ein Spiel, das dich nicht nur fordert, sondern auch belohnt – ein Erlebnis, das von Anfang bis Ende pure, ungefilterte Freude bereitet. Für jeden, der den Nervenkitzel sucht, sich allein den Horden der Hölle zu stellen, ist DOOM ein absolutes Muss.

Bewertung:

    Grafik: 9/10
    Gameplay: 10/10
    Story: 7/10
    Atmosphäre: 10/10
    Gesamt: 9/10 – „Ein modernes Epos des Wahnsinns und der Zerstörung.“

184966461.review:
Игра в своём жанре, да и в целом, очень даже хороша. В ней великолепный геймплей, крутое мочилово с монстрами, стрельба, разнообразие оружия и испытаний. Кампанию я прошёл с большим удовольствием и, конечно, полюбил игру за геймплейную часть, а не за сюжет. Но это DOOM, и это простительно.
Кампании в этой игре я ставлю 10/10 (давно я так не кайфовал).
__________
Сетевая часть игры просто ужасна, играл в неё чисто ради достижений.
Ранги сделаны убого, попадаются читеры. Основное время, проведённое в игре, я потратил именно на сетевые режимы, прокачивая ранги только ради ненужных танцев и костюмов, которые на геймплей почти не влияют. Но именно из-за этих костюмов я провёл столько часов в игре (ради достижений), и именно из-за сетевого режима у меня больше нет желания возвращаться в DOOM вообще.
Единственное, за что можно похвалить сетевую игру, — это карты. Они сделаны очень хорошо, но местами запутанно. Здесь не получится сидеть в углу и ждать противника: развилок и переходов множество, бегай где хочешь и ищи врагов. Также можно поиграть за демонов.
Но в других аспектах сетевой режим я просто не рекомендую.
Сетевой режим 3/10.
________________
Тем, кто будет выбивать достижения в этой игре, ДЕРЖИТЕСЬ И УДАЧИ ВАМ.

184802457.review:
La trama es simple: eres el DOOM Slayer, un tipo que probablemente pide café con sangre en lugar de azúcar. El infierno desata su peor pesadilla en Marte y tú decides devolverles el favor, una bala y una motosierra a la vez.

El ritmo del juego es pura adrenalina: no hay cobertura, no hay pausas. Solo tú, música de metal que te hace sentir invencible y hordas de demonios que aprenden rápidamente que no deberían haberte molestado. Es como una clase de cardio, pero en lugar de perder peso, pierdes demonios.

Los gráficos y los entornos son tan detallados que casi te sientes mal por destruir el lugar... hasta que recuerdas que estás en el infierno y eso es literalmente tu trabajo.

La mejor parte es el diseño de enemigos: cada demonio tiene su propia forma de intentar matarte, pero tú siempre tienes una forma más creativa de matarlos primero. Glory kills nunca pasan de moda.

En resumen: DOOM es violento, rápido, y absolutamente glorioso. No es un juego para los débiles de corazón, pero si amas la acción sin frenos, este es el infierno que querrás visitar una y otra vez. 666/10, volvería a abrir un portal al infierno.

184777139.review:
I can't recommend due to the following reasons:
- "Rip and tear" they say -well, can't do that without ammo. Yep, you run out of ammo fast.
- No focus on story: Challenges and arena fights are major.
- Boss fights are totally bland: Repetitive attacks pattern and all the time another phase. One of the bosses start circling like a prima ballerina -literally.
- "Easy" should be relaxing, why is it the same as normal?
- Bad map design: Most of the time you get locked in an area with demons and you can only get out when you killed them all. This repeats many, many times. Really boring.
- Inconsistency in mouse speed. Sometimes it is normal, the next moment it is slower -and there is a mouse lag while in menus -IN MENUS!
- The sound quality changes many times. Example: Half a map the sound quality is like an old TV, next time it sounds like in a cave, the next map the bass got boosted.
- Heavy focus on challenges and achievements: Without them you can't upgrade your weapon and skills.
- Finish moves (Glory kills): At the beginning they're awesome but they happen so many times that it bored me out after 3 hours -and the demons recovers their hit points if you don't use the chance, so you need more ammo to kill them ...what makes the glory kills annoying and less glorious.
- A weapon does not make the same damage. Sometimes I need 2 shots for an Imp, sometimes 4, when they stand in front of me though. Same with all the other weapons.

184712344.review:
Doom (2016) is a triumphant return to form for one of gaming’s most iconic franchises. It perfectly captures the raw, adrenaline-pumping essence of the original Doom while modernizing the experience for a new generation. From the moment you pick up the shotgun and rip through your first demon, you’re thrust into a relentless, high-octane dance of carnage and chaos that rarely lets up.

The combat is the heart of the game, and it’s nothing short of exhilarating. Every encounter feels like a carefully choreographed battle where speed, precision, and aggression are your greatest allies. The Glory Kill system not only adds a brutal flair to the action but also rewards you with health and resources, keeping you in the fight and encouraging you to stay on the offensive. The weapons feel powerful, each one offering a distinct and satisfying way to mow down the hordes of Hell.

The level design is another highlight, seamlessly blending classic arena-style combat zones with modern exploration elements. Secret areas and collectibles are scattered throughout, giving a nostalgic nod to the original games while rewarding players who take the time to explore. The soundtrack, a pulsating mix of industrial and metal, is the perfect backdrop to the chaos, driving the intensity of each battle to new heights.

While the story takes a backseat to the action, its minimalist approach works in the game’s favor. You’re not here for a deep narrative—you’re here to rip and tear, and Doom (2016) delivers that experience flawlessly. The game knows what it is and never tries to be anything else, embracing its unapologetically brutal identity from start to finish.

In a world of cover-based shooters and hand-holding mechanics, Doom (2016) stands out as a pure, unfiltered FPS experience. It’s a love letter to fans of the series and a masterclass in how to reboot a classic. For anyone who loves fast-paced, visceral action, this is a must-play.

184653123.review:
At its best, Doom is everything it should be: a single-player campaign that’s just you, your super shotgun, and barely the amount of ammunition required to kill every single demon on Mars. It feels like a Doom game as you desperately try to find health pickups to keep you going, an ever-growing menagerie of demons snapping at your heels. It's exhausting and exciting and a little bit dumb, and when you're into it you're all the way in. At its worst, Doom is a repetitive series of enclosed rooms filled with demons, all of which you must kill to advance, complemented by a derivative and poorly thought-out multiplayer mode.
First impressions wise, Doom strikes all the right notes. The Union Aerospace Corporation's research facility on Mars runs red with the blood of employees who’ve learned a new meaning for the phrase 'wrongful termination,' but that barely matters to the inexplicably mute Doomguy, who shoots anything and everything which moves. Starting with only the pistol encourages you to focus on the diabolically delightful Glory Kill system — shoot your nearest Demon enough that they become staggered and highlighted in blue or orange, and if you press F (or R3 on a PS4 controller) while standing next to them you will rend them asunder. That is to say, you'll tear off their limbs and, in more than a few cases, joyfully beat them with their own appendages.

184609841.review:
Probably among the top 10 games ever made.

Adding some draft notes before full review:

Cons:
The possessed scientists are Doom's version of zombies. The art design is excellent, but their voices are too loud/screeching which breaks the quiet lurking-dread type moments in which they appear. Atmospheric mournful zombie moans would have better suited to these otherwise quiet moments, and would have offered a contrast to the more noisy enemies that appear soon afterwards once full-battle commences.

The Rune Trials are sparse and don't break-up the pace of the main missions, which is welcome. But, when dying, and re-entering the trial, you must click the "fight again" button twice, and space-bar once, just to get back into the action, which breaks the flow. Why can't simple space-bar presses do the job?

Glory Kills are great, but they're too frequent, making the game feel more like a melee focused game than a shooter. IMO much of the fun in the original Doom I & II comes from the satisfaction of killing enemies with guns; and Doom 2016's glory kills, because they occur so frequently, feel like too much of a departure from classic Doom's gun-centric gameplay.

This point may sound like an embarrassment of riches, but hear me out: In classic Doom, there is little that breaks the flow / gets in the way of the gameplay. But in Doom 2016 you are required to enter the TAB menu on a frequent basis to: 1) choose suit upgrades, 2) choose weapon upgrades, 3) juggle rune slots, 4) frequently check the map (which is done as an overlay in Doom I & II - which prevents the breaking of pacing or immersion in those games), 5) read codex entries - this latter point could've been implemented like Doom 3's audio codex entries that you can listen to as you explore the environment --- These things don't ruin Doom 2016's pacing, but they do cause the game to feel like its 80% FPS and 20% RPG.

Having played every Doom game in existence, then all the Quake multiplayer madness, I really should have liked this game. Sadly, I don’t like it and I struggled to put my finger on why. I was barely into the game, and I felt fatigued as if I were wasting my time. Then I finally figured it out. It was the pacing and the glory kill system that were the problem and there is no way to fix it. 

	I am no stranger to first-person shooters, and they all have a familiar mechanic that I really love. You shoot everything that moves until it stops moving then you look for something else to shoot. In Doom, they opted for a new mechanic where you shoot everything that moves until it moves differently, and then you glory kill it. 

	In case you’re not familiar with the term, a glory kill is where you perform a finishing maneuver on an already defeated enemy. In Doom’s case, these are short, well-animated gore fests that can be really shocking the first few times you see them. You basically shoot up an enemy until they enter a helpless state, swaying back and forth as if drunk. Then you run up to them and finish them off with a quick animated take-down. This rewards the player with a small amount of health and armor which seems to be part of the core mechanic. You need that health and armor because doom is stingy with placement of it on the map, and it can run short fast. 

	However, after your two hundredth glory kill, you have seen all the animations and they are rapidly getting boring. I got bored with it in less than an hour of play as I asked myself the eternal question. Why did they give me all these guns if I have to kill everything with my bare hands?

	It seems like they should have just given me a sword or a big hammer or something because you have to kill nearly all the monsters up close and personal, and this just gets old fast. You see, the original Doom games all had one thing in common: long-range. You did your best to engage everything from as far away as possible and focused on targets that were close to restore your range. This game is very different and encourages you to fight at very close ranges so you can get those glory kills. 

	But Omni I hear you say, you don’t have to use them. Well, that’s where you are wrong. Unfortunately, this mechanic is baked into the game's DNA and you can’t turn it off. Ammo and armor aren’t plentiful on the maps, and if you insist on shooting things to death, you will quickly discover you're low on everything. You see ammo and armor drops from every monster you perform a glory kill on, and you need those drops to survive. Using the chainsaw to finish an enemy off turns them into a loot pinata and showers you with goodies. 

	Now I love a good loot shower, but I wanted more doom where I ran about guns blazing and left a trail of dead enemies in my wake. I want to be able to kill them with my guns, and only my guns like god intended it to be. None of this, sissy; run up and kick the weakened enemy so I can get some of my bullets back. Not to mention that the kills themselves kept drawing me out of the pacing. Having to stop every three to five seconds to make another glory kill just ruins the fast-paced gunplay I was craving. 

	Now, are the graphics good? You bet they are. Some of the best I have ever seen with enemies and the aforementioned glory kills animated to perfection. The music and sounds are a solid addition, really helping to set the player's blood pumping. Level design is creative, with plenty to explore and look at. I really felt like I was on Mars in some kind of laboratory complex while hell invaded. 

	But all of those good points can’t overcome the fact that this game didn’t play like the doom I remember. I don’t care for this game, and I am very sad to say I won’t play more of it.

184550231.review:
纯爽割草爽游，好评给这款游戏的制作，完成度很出色，音乐美术带来的沉浸感都非常好，很容易让人杀得心跳加速。但是游戏在爽这条路线上还有很大进步空间的。
1.很多人诟病的地图问题就不多说了，我认为不可能有人玩这个游戏不会感受到哪怕一次“我现在去哪？我现在往哪走？”的疑惑，杀完一个地区，最常见的是一段枯燥无聊的找路体验，游戏地图的引导和结构设计得非常糟糕。
2.击杀的直接反馈还是有多可以改进的地方，壮烈击杀的操作手感很好，但是动画可以做得更激进一些，游戏中有很多类似拧断脖子的壮烈击杀动画，这种击杀还是太“温和”了，如果有一拳打爆敌人的肚子并且喷一屏幕血的动画一定爽破天际；游戏最爽的部分是激活"狂暴”BUFF时，玩家可以无条件对眼前的敌人执行壮烈击杀，真的是爽得蛇精，但是狂暴BUFF在流程中很稀少，如果能让玩家主动触发该效果会更好，例如短时间内快速、精彩地连续击杀能主动开启狂暴等；此外，作为一个FPS游戏，游戏居然没有击杀和命中音效，我不敢想加个好听的击杀音效游戏能爽到什么程度。
3.弹药问题，游戏鼓励玩家通过链锯杀敌来获得弹药补给，但是因为链锯子弹只能偶尔拾取到以及杀大怪需要耗费很多链锯子弹的问题，玩家使用链锯的积极性是不足的，我觉得改成链锯按时间充能会更好。在游戏前期玩家弹药储备上限低，加上自动武器对逐渐增多的大型怪物刮痧，子弹几乎处于一种“够用但短缺”的状态下，这一点大大影响了爽感，也削弱了玩家的战斗力，我在中前期有一段时间玩得特别不爽，但是一切都在解锁满级双管喷（每次装填能喷2次）之后改变了，满级双管喷简直秒天秒地，所有怪都是纸糊的，从那以后我就几乎没死过，游戏体验也是从这里开始直线上升的。
随便写写的，7.2小时中等难度战役通关，之前玩到炼锅炉没玩下去重玩了一次，仅供参考。

184543679.review:
[b]Genel Bakış[/b]

DOOM, id Software tarafından geliştirilen ve Bethesda Softworks tarafından yayımlanan, hızlı tempolu bir birinci şahıs nişancı oyunudur. 2016'da çıkış yapan bu oyun, klasik DOOM serisinin modern bir yeniden tasarımı olarak karşımıza çıkıyor. Hızlı aksiyon, şiddet dolu savaşlar ve nefes kesici metal müzikleriyle tam bir adrenalin deneyimi sunan DOOM, modern FPS oyunlarının nasıl olması gerektiğine dair güçlü bir örnek oluşturuyor.

[b]Oynanış Mekanikleri[/b]
DOOM’un oynanışı saf aksiyon. Adeta hiç durmadan koşuyor, zıplıyor ve silahlarınızı vahşi iblislere doğrultarak onları parçalıyorsunuz. Akıcı hareket mekanikleri, yüksek tempolu çatışmalar ve her biri farklı bir oynanış stratejisi gerektiren düşman çeşitliliği oyun boyunca heyecanı hiç düşürmüyor. Sağlık ve cephane kazanmanın yolları arasında, "glory kill" adı verilen yakın dövüş bitirici hareketleri bulunuyor ve bu, savaşın temposunu daha da yükseltiyor.

Ancak mekaniklerin odaklandığı noktalar nedeniyle oyun bazen tek boyutlu hissettirebilir. Hikaye anlatımı arka planda bırakılarak tamamen aksiyona odaklanılmış; bu, bazı oyuncular için eksiklik olabilir. Ayrıca, her ne kadar özgürlük hissi sunsa da oyun, nispeten dar alanlarda geçiyor ve bu, daha geniş dünyalar keşfetmek isteyen oyuncuların hayal kırıklığına uğramasına neden olabilir.

[b]Grafikler ve Ses[/b]
DOOM'un grafiksel detayları olağanüstü. İblislerin grotesk tasarımları, çevrelerin korkutucu atmosferi ve kan gölüne dönen savaş sahneleri son derece etkileyici bir görsellik sunuyor. Oyun, görsel tasarımın yanında teknik performansıyla da dikkat çekiyor; yüksek kare hızlarında çalışarak, hareketin akıcılığını asla kaybetmiyor. Ancak, bazı çevresel tasarımlar zamanla monotonlaşabiliyor. Mars'ın ve cehennem seviyelerinin yoğun kırmızı ve turuncu paleti, çeşitlilik arayan gözlere zamanla yorucu gelebilir.

Ses tasarımı, oyunun en güçlü yanlarından biri. Mick Gordon’un bestelediği heavy metal ağırlıklı soundtrack, aksiyon sahneleriyle mükemmel bir uyum içinde. Patlama sesleri, silah efektleri ve iblislerin kükremeleri oyuncuyu sürekli tetikte tutuyor. Ancak bu yoğun ses deneyimi, bazı anlarda bunaltıcı olabilir ve düşük tempolu anlara yer verilmemesi sebebiyle oyuncuya soluklanma fırsatı vermiyor.

[b]Hikaye ve Zorluk[/b]
DOOM’un hikayesi, Mars’taki bir Union Aerospace Corporation tesisinde geçiyor ve iblis istilasını durdurma amacıyla klasik bir "günü kurtarma" senaryosu sunuyor. Ancak hikaye, derin bir anlatı arayanlar için hayal kırıklığı yaratabilir; bu, tamamen aksiyon merkezli bir FPS oyunu. Zorluk seviyeleri oldukça çeşitli; her biri farklı bir deneyim sunuyor ve özellikle en yüksek seviyelerde oyun, hız ve refleksleri zorlayan gerçek bir meydan okuma haline geliyor.

[b]Pozitif:[/b]

-Hızlı tempolu, yoğun ve tatmin edici savaşlar
-Muhteşem görseller ve performans
-Enerji veren heavy metal müzikler
-Çeşitli düşman tasarımları ve etkileyici boss dövüşleri

[b]Negatif:[/b]

-Hikaye ve anlatım odaklı oyuncular için yetersiz kalabilir
-Zamanla monotonlaşan çevresel tasarım
-Daha geniş açık dünya unsurları eksik

[b]Genel Değerlendirme[/b]

[b]Oynanış:[/b] 9/10 (Kesintisiz aksiyon, kusursuz mekanikler)
[b]Grafikler:[/b] 8/10 (Teknik açıdan olağanüstü ancak çeşitlilik sınırlı)
[b]Hikaye:[/b] 6/10 (Daha çok bir fon müziği gibi, derinlik beklemeyin)
[b]Genel:[/b] 8/10

[b]Sonuç:[/b]
DOOM (2016), tam anlamıyla nefes kesici bir aksiyon sunuyor ve FPS türüne yeni bir soluk getiriyor. Hikaye anlatımından çok savaşın keyfine varanlar için kusursuz bir deneyim. Ancak daha geniş dünyalar, çeşitlilik ve hikaye odaklı derinlik arıyorsanız, DOOM sizin için ideal olmayabilir. Yine de, bu hız ve kaos şölenini tatmak her oyuncunun deneyimlemesi gereken bir adrenalin macerası.

Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 (5/5)
"Le carnage à l’état pur : un FPS frénétique et jouissif qui remet DOOM au sommet de l’enfer vidéoludique."

DOOM (2016), développé par id Software, est un reboot magistral qui conserve l’âme brutale et rapide de la franchise emblématique tout en modernisant son gameplay pour un public contemporain. Avec une action frénétique, une bande-son métallique épique, et un level design exemplaire, ce jeu est une leçon magistrale de FPS.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Gameplay frénétique et viscéral : Pas de couverture, pas de pauses. DOOM encourage une agressivité sans relâche, où chaque combat est une danse sanguinaire. Les Glory Kills, des exécutions rapides et brutales, sont à la fois stylées et stratégiques, car elles récompensent le joueur avec de la santé ou des munitions.

✅ Level design exceptionnel : Les niveaux regorgent de secrets, de chemins alternatifs et d’arènes conçues pour des affrontements intenses. L’exploration est gratifiante sans nuire au rythme de l’action.

✅ Une bande-son électrisante : La musique de Mick Gordon mélange métal industriel et électro, amplifiant l’intensité des combats. Chaque riff donne envie de détruire des démons avec encore plus de style.

✅ Visuels spectaculaires : Les graphismes sont détaillés et fluides, même dans les moments les plus chaotiques. L’esthétique infernale de Mars et de l’Enfer est parfaitement réalisée.

✅ Fluidité exemplaire : Le moteur id Tech 6 assure une action constante à 60 fps, même sur des configurations modestes. Le feeling des armes, le feedback des tirs, et les animations sont d’une précision chirurgicale.

✅ Respect de l’héritage : Tout en modernisant son gameplay, DOOM conserve l’essence de la série originale : une action brutale, des armes iconiques, et une ambiance badass qui ne se prend pas trop au sérieux.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Histoire minimaliste : Bien que le scénario soit intentionnellement simple (vous êtes là pour massacrer des démons, point), certains joueurs pourraient préférer une narration plus développée.

⚠️ Mode multijoueur décevant : Bien qu’il soit compétent, le mode multijoueur ne parvient pas à égaler la qualité de la campagne solo et manque de profondeur pour rivaliser avec les FPS compétitifs modernes.

En conclusion :
DOOM (2016) est un chef-d’œuvre qui redéfinit ce qu’un FPS peut être. Sa combinaison de gameplay frénétique, de visuels spectaculaires et de musique galvanisante en fait un incontournable pour les amateurs d’action pure et dure. Si vous voulez ressentir la puissance brute d’un Space Marine déchaîné, ce jeu est fait pour vous.

🎮 Verdict final :
Une campagne solo exemplaire qui redonne au genre FPS ses lettres de noblesse. Oubliez la discrétion, ici, c’est la sauvagerie qui règne.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé : 12 à 15 heures pour la campagne principale, beaucoup plus si vous explorez tous les secrets et modes de difficulté.
✨ Note personnelle : Les démons n’ont jamais été aussi funs à exploser. Et ce Super Shotgun ? Une vraie déclaration d’amour au FPS old-school. 🧟‍♂️🔫🔥

184443946.review:
Some of the best games are those that understand themselves, and DOOM is one of those games. It is uncompromising in its presentation and delivery, and it shows. It's also refreshing to see a game stay true to its original vision while updating the gameplay for a modern audience, including just enough completionist content to keep things interesting. There are a number of optional armor, weapon and equipment upgrades to be made in-game using a merit-based currency which (importantly) do not feel tacked on, but the [slayer!] benefits greatly from. There are also collectibles and secret locations within each level to be found while exploring, which offers the player some replay-ability. 

The graphics and the environments consistently impress and level design always keep you on your toes.

As for the story, while not groundbreaking, is enjoyable if you choose to engage with it, and succeeds in keeping things interesting and "fleshing" out the universe of DOOM. 

One of my favorite aspects of the game are the Text Logs scattered throughout each level. Each text log provides a few paragraphs of information on things like lore, monsters, characters, and environments. Typically, most players wouldn't care to take 5 minutes to read something in the middle of their shooting game,
so I know what you're thinking, "Really? Reading in a doom game?" Yes! If you want to immerse yourself in the story and learn more in-detail information about characters (and sometimes monster weaknesses!), then do yourself a favor and try it out. I was always impressed by the creative writing, atmosphere, and depth it added to the experience, and it's a large part of the game that's easy to overlook.

I couldn't write a review for this game without mentioning the soundtrack composed by Mick Gordon, which deserves to be heard at 100 percent volume.

I had an exhilarating time playing through the campaign (on ultra-violence difficulty), facing challenges, frustration and anger. I had my moments of weakness, but I always came back stronger and my efforts were always rewarded.

Become the Doom Slayer. Administer death on hell-spawn and send them back whence they came. 10/10


Edit: I spent a long time trying to fix the mouse-feel (and didn't figure it out until after I beat it) 

So, after much research, here's how:

In game, turn off Motion Blur and Vsync.

Copy and paste this into your game's launch options, under Preferences (gear icon);

+set m_smooth 0

Then, in your NVIDIA Control Panel, find the program file for Doom. These settings override settings in game. 

Follow these instructions:

-Click Manage 3D settings, then click Program Settings tab.

-Check the box that says "Show only programs found on this computer."

-Find and click "Doomx64.exe" in the dropdown file list. If you use Vulkan click 
 "Doomx64vk.exe". I set the same settings on both just to be safe.

Use the following settings:

-Set Max Frame Rate to "60". You can set it higher, but you don't want your computer rendering frames you don't need. FYI higher refresh rate = higher response time.

-If you want Vsync, turn it on here, keep it off in-game. (I prefer this)

-Set Low Latency Mode "On". If you have a powerful CPU set to "Ultra" (I also prefer this)

-Set Power Management Mode to " Prefer Maximum Performance"

-Set Thread Optimization "Off". This is helpful in some cases. Turn back on if you experience 
 frame drops.

Lastly, check your windows mouse settings and DISABLE "Increase Pointer Precision".
My mouse feel in-game and in-menu wasn't fixed until I did this.

Hope this was helpful. Rip and Tear!

Pretty good arena shooter, it just lacks in enemy variety and movement options (namely, a dash).
Encounters felt pretty samey from the middle to the end - sure, they spam more enemies, but you get a BFG to clear them, so nothing much changed. The arenas themselves also blend in visually - lots of blood everywhere, reds and oranges, but what can you do.

Ammo management is also mostly a non-issue due to chainsaw kills spawning so much ammo, so it feels more like an annoying reminder to use the chainsaw.

Also, the game starts very slow, with an absolutely horrendous pistol, so beware of that.

Surprisingly, the plot is decent, although it is heavily carried by Samuel Hayden - no other character save for VEGA has any depth whatsoever. The lore is okay, but the lore you get in hell is just a set up for DOOM Eternal AFAIK, and the rest is "haha this company is hilariously unethical and praises hell unironically for some reason".

184104914.review:
The biggest obstacle you can face when writing a review of a game like Doom 2016 is saying something fresh and new about a title like this. Game is at this point iconic and so recognizable that there is no real point of saying anything more, because many people before me already said everything about it. Nevertheless, maybe I still can smuggle a little thought, don’t you think?

I'm gonna be real with you, folks. I slept on Doom 2016. When it was announced, I didn't have a strong response to this information. 8 years ago the fps market was dominated by A) Call of Duty knock offs — a brown, grey military shooters based on real world conflicts, scripted and streamlined to the point that playing them feels more like sitting in cart on a some kind creepy theme park ride; or B) Story focused pieces resembling games like Bioshock, with disgustingly weak shooting, slow and clunky, because players apparently lost all dexterity and reaction time in a span of a few years. On top of that, ID reputation was severely damaged before by Doom3 and RAGE — ok games with fun gameplay, but in the case of ID doing ok, mediocre games were unacceptable. On top of that Carmac left the company and went doing VR shenanigans. So when Doom 2016 was announced, I felt nothing. I expected an average game tailored for modern gamers.

And then I went to my friend and played a game. And my eyes were opened.

It is funny how ID can do things like this over and over again. Back in 1993 they single handedly created an entire new genre of computer games, and now in 2016 saved said genre from collapsing. That's a feat, I'm gonna admit. Because in 2016 they were not only creating a one game, they also gave the world an opportunity to show other developers that there is a market for old-school fps games, games focused on being fast, hitting hard, precise aiming and fluid gameplay. Thanks to Doom 2016 today we can also play games like Dusk, Amid Evil, Project Warlock, Ion Fury or Ultrakill. And we were saved from scourge of COD or Fornite clones, pumped on a daily basis by uninspired, spineless cowards who only want to extract from gamers more money while doing absolutely minimum work. Yeah, I'm talking about you, AAA developers, you worthless, lazy, disgusting piece of sh…

Ekhm. Anyway.

So, what changed in the game? Surprisingly much enough and not. Once again, we are single-man army facing hordes of deamons from hell, but this time we are not some regular dude with fast feets and bunch of guns, we are the legendary, mythical doom slayer, who somehow survived Doom 1, 2 and Doom 64, gains superpower of being constantly super pissed and come back in alternate reality, where UAC… you know, what the best part of story in Doom 2016? Game actively mocks all those story-focused tropes from other games, giving a middle finger to all of this crap and encourages players to ignore it. Oh, some NPC talking? Doom slayer response? Punching. Kicking. Destroying. And you know, I like good story oriented games — hell, my favorite game of all time is Planescape Torment, a game focusing only on story, with tons of reading — but I know when storytelling is needed, and when not. Games like Doom DO NOT need deep characters, immersive plot or themes, morals… They need blood, gore, guns and action. And Doom 2016 delivers all those. Someone can say that it always delivered and always has been without story, but between 1993 and 2016 so many things changed it is worth pointing this out. 

Core gameplay is still here, albeit with a few changes. Instead of carefully placing monsters to create interesting combat scenarios throughout the entire level, the game now focuses on an arena-shooter look-alike experience. There is an empty corridor, then a big room with combat, then another empty corridor, then another combat room… But it's not boring and repetitive, like in Serious Sam or Painkiller, where you can sum up the entire combat with holding the S key and pressing the left mouse, because hordes of enemies are dumb and going after the player in a straight line. In Doom 2016 it works better due to how different types of enemies work together when trying to destroy your ass. Soldiers trying to keep distance and shoot from a far, imps leaping around and tossing fireballs, distracting mostly, Hellknights and Pinkys putting pressure on you by constantly being close with melee attacks… Everything works flawlessly. 

And yet you never feel overwhelmed. You feel like a badass — another thing that modern shooters like to forget. You are always in control of the battlefield, always on top, due to sheer brutality Doom Slayer can enact on enemies. The finisher system works amazingly well and has a nice feeling to all animations. But it's not only for show, it gives you HP back, so it's crucial to survival on the battlefield. It will help you many, many times. But melee is not the only fun way to play. Because for the most part of the game you will be using guns. All iconic arsenal is here, albeit with little changes. We have a pistol, now with infinite ammo, standard shotgun, beloved super shotgun, Heavy Machine Gun (with rockets!), too much — in my opinion — nerfed Plasma Rifle, Chaingun with extra barrels, rocket launcher, BFG… Devs also added Gauss Rifle — high precision, high damage gun that rewards mechanical skills and good aiming.

But hey, there is more! Because now weapons have mods, they can change the functioning of the entire arsenal. Shotgun now can also have a grenade launcher or 3 shot burst mode. Rocket launcher have manual detonation or guided missiles, HMG have mini rockets or scope. Every weapon has two mods and you can swap between them on the fly, AND they can be upgraded with weapon points, which you collect by killing enemies, doing challenges and finding secrets, so you are constantly motivated to play above regular engagement if you want a fully developed arsenal. On top of that, weapons have mastery, specific conditions you need to achieve (like killing a certain type of enemy in a certain way) to unlock the final upgrade.

I have only one criticism about weapon upgrades and challenges: they can be cheesed. You can kill enemies required for upgrade, reload the game, kill them again, and progress will be saved. Thanks to that you can quickly upgrade weapons to max level and have an easier time later. So devs, next time maybe instead cranking numbers you will disable progression and just make smaller requirements. Game is already long — 12 hours in the main campaign, no one will refund it, instead going for quota, maybe making a more memorable experience?

Cherry on the top are runes — passive abilities that can heavily enrich your gameplay (aerial control, longer glory kills opportunity window etc), and standard character upgrades like more health and more ammo capacity. All of them must be found through an exploring map, many of them are hidden, so you are always motivated to pay attention during playing level.

I will end this review by talking little about difficulty. When I first played Doom 2016 back in the days I played on Nightmare. It was a funny experience, I felt like exactly on point with all those challenges and combat scenarios. But then I played Doom Eternal on Nightmare. It was… something. Now, when I was going back to this game for all those sweet, sweet achievements, I hopped in only on Ultra-violence, the gentleman's way to play. And it was too easy for me. I counted all my deaths, and it was only 9, four legit, 5 because I was more focused on challenges for weapon upgrades than regular gameplay. So my advice for people who want to play this game after Doom Eternal — play on Nightmare.

Now. It's over. Go home or something.

184069807.review:
[b]Плюсы:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Геймплей. DOOM 2016 предлагает интенсивный и динамичный геймплей, который держит игрока в напряжении на протяжении всей игры. Быстрый темп стрельбы и множество врагов создают ощущение постоянного движения и действия.
    [*]Графика и звук. Графика в игре впечатляет своей детализацией и качеством, а звуковые эффекты добавляют атмосферности и реализма. Музыкальное сопровождение также отлично подходит к игровому процессу.
    [*]Разнообразие уровней. Игра предлагает разнообразные уровни, каждый из которых имеет свои особенности и врагов. Это не даёт игре стать однообразной и скучной.
    [*]Арсенал оружия. В игре представлен широкий арсенал оружия, каждое из которого имеет свои уникальные характеристики и стиль стрельбы. Это позволяет игроку выбрать оружие по своему вкусу и стилю игры.
    [*]Сюжет. Хотя сюжет в DOOM 2016 не является главным аспектом игры, он всё же интересен и увлекателен. Игроки могут узнать больше о мире DOOM и его обитателях.
[/list]
[b]Минусы:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Сложность управления. Некоторые игроки могут столкнуться с проблемами при управлении персонажем, особенно в сложных ситуациях.
    [*]Технические проблемы. Иногда в игре могут возникать технические проблемы, такие как сбои или задержки.
    [*]Однообразие некоторых локаций. Некоторые локации в игре могут показаться однообразными и скучными.
    [*]Проблемы с балансом. Некоторые враги и боссы могут быть слишком сильными или слабыми, что может повлиять на баланс игры.
    [*]Высокая сложность. Некоторые миссии могут быть очень сложными и требовать много времени и усилий для прохождения.
[/list]

183802810.review:
DOOM (2016) holt das klassische Shooter-Gameplay des Orignal-Klassikers perfekt in die moderne Zeit und verliert dabei nichts von seinem besonderen Reiz. Man merkt in jedem Aspekt dieses Spiel die Liebe zum Original.
Dabei punktet das Spiel vor allem an seinem grandiosen Leveldesign, welches den Spieler nach und nach mit neuen Features und einzigartigen Waffen in Kontakt bringt und neue Gegner einführt, sodass eine organische Steigerung vonstatten geht. Auch das Erkunden innerhalb der Level hat mich begeistert, da es viele Secrets zu finden gibt, die äußerst belohnend und hilfreich für die Aufwertung des Charakters ist.
Neben diesem Aspekt besticht das Spiel auch durch seine visuelle Präsentation. Von den blutgetränkten Hallen der Marsbasis bis zu den höllischen Landschaften hat es mich durch seinen perfekt inszenierten Sci-Fi-Horror-Look maßlos begeistert. Ergänzt wird die Atmosphäre durch den spektakulären und mitreißenden Soundtrack von Mick Gordon, dessen pulsierende Metal-Riffs das Adrenalin während der Kämpfe in die Höhe treibt und jede Begegnung mit den Dämonenhorden noch intensiver macht.
Auch wenn in einem solchen Spiel die Story meistens zweitrangig ist, so hat sie mich interessiert mitfiebern lassen - mit einer Spielzeit von etwa 10 bis 15 Stunden bietet es genau die richtige Länge, um die Spannung bis zum Ende aufrechtzuerhalten. Die fünf Schwierigkeitsgrade bieten eine gute Abwechselung für Neueinsteiger und Veteranen,
Neben der Hauptkampagne möchte ich auch den SnapMap-Modus hervorheben, in dem Spieler ihre eigenen Level entwerfen können. Eine schöne Umsetzung, die ich gerne häufiger in anderen Spielen sehen wollen würde.
Insgesamt kann ich das Spiel wirklich sehr empfehlen! Für mich ist es ein grandioses Beispiel dafür, wie ein Klassiker der Videospielgeschichte erfolgreich modernisiert werden kann, ohne seinen Kern zu verlieren. Jede Minute bietet ein höllisches Vergnügen, das seinesgleichen sucht.

183603284.review:
Con el mero nombre y portada, muchos de los gamers vieja guardia por allá en los finales de los 90 e inicios del nuevo milenio recordarán este clásico, para aquellos que aún tienen dudas: tienen que comprar este reboot de la franquicia.

No es solo cuestión de ver el nivel de detalle tanto gráfico como narrativo que le han puesto a esta nueva versión, es de admirar también cosas como la jugabilidad adictiva, la variedad de armas con su respectivas modificaciones, la infinidad de enemigos, niveles, coleccionables, secretos, etc.

Debo admitir que en serio se la rifaron, a comparación del último Doom 3 que tampoco estuvo tan mal pero si mezclaba cosas de horror y suspenso en vez de la carnicería tan ansiada que muchos experimentamos en los clásicos Doom II y Doom 64, id software se vuelve a lucir con una entrega maravillosamente pulida.

La rejugabilidad de las misiones, el multijugador online, los rankings de arcade y, sobre todo, esa espeluznante dificultad incluso en modo "normal", harán que todos los fanáticos de la saga y nuevos adeptos curiosos por un FPS cargado de sangre se enganchen por unos buenos meses intentando conseguir todos los logros. 10/10.

183535093.review:
Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5)
Classic Doom, today.

What id Software has done with the gameplay is nothing short of extraordinary. Level design, power ups, glory kills... every aspect of the game has been designed to push the player toward close combat. As a result it plays like a classic Doom game while still feeling modern. And what a fabulous experience classic Doom is. Sadly, the only approach to level design has been to build them as a collection of smaller arenas, thus making combat more predictable. Worth at full price.
